intro: Iridopsis textilis, commonly known as the textile dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. Iridopsis textilis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important species in ecological studies of drought-resistant flora.
